inn1.comm: Chamu is off the mark straight away, cutting down at a short wide delivery to get it down to third man. He's clapped along by a group of schoolchildren near the scoreboard, in a section of the ground known as Soweto corner.
Dawlat hits a length, but it's too straight and he's nudged down to fine leg.
a bit of swing, a bit of seam, and the ball leaves the batsman outside off. Chamu shoulders arms.
punched to extra cover, off the back foot. Not timed.
and again. That's a nice line from Dawlat, with two slips, but it is just wide enough for Chamu to leave alone.
crunched off the back foot! Chamu rolls his forearms over the top of a length delivery to send it bouncing to the cover boundary.
a gentle start, and Mutumbami watches a full length delivery go past him outside off stump.
a little straighter, zoning in on off stump, and the batsman presses forward to defend.
cracking delivery! Mirwais isn't the quickest, but this is the perfect line on off stump to get the batsman playing. He's then beaten by some movement away from the bat.
Mirwais is looking for that outswinger again, but he's pitched this one too straight and is clipped through square leg.
Mutumbami comes forward and drives gently to cover point.
wobbling around outside off stump, and left well alone.
Chamu's backfoot press lands almost at is feet and dribbles towards point. Richmond is alert to the single, and calls him through. Good run.
Mutumbami is up on tippy-toes to push this to cover point. Straight to the fielder.
pushed rather more firmly into the covers this time, but straight to the fielder.
Mutumbami is a little early into this front foot drive, and the bottom hand takes over the shot, sending the ball into the leg side. Just enough room for a single.
on a length, just outside off, and left alone.
and that fielder is immediately into action, stopping a drive aimed right at him.
past the outside edge! Mutumbami wanted to flash this away off the back foot, but it was too close to him.
and now this one jags in off the seam. Mutumbami is taken a little by surprise, and the ball comes off the inside edge of his forward poke. Ooh and aahs from behind the wicket.
a tip and run single, the ball rolling right between the midwicket and mid on fielders.
just short of a good length, but great line from the bowler and Chamu defends.
a shade fuller, but the same line, and Chamu crouches forward in defence.
past the edge! Mirwais has been bang on target this morning. Lovely bowling.
full, outside off and seaming away quite sharply. Left alone.
Mutumbami leans into a drive this time, but he can't find the gap in the covers.
great, diving stop from Nabi! Mutumbami spanked another drive to extra cover, wide of the fielder, but Nabi flew to his left to stop it cleanly.
Dawlat aims straighter, a middle and off line, and the batsman defends.

trapped in front! Mutumbami stayed at the crease, his feet didn't really go anywhere, and flicked across his front pad. There were two sounds, but I believe that was the ball hitting the front pad and and the back pad. A fairly straightforward decision for the umpire, and Afghanistan strike early!
a breeze riffles across the ground as Dawlat steams in, jamming the ball onto the seam outside off and beating the edge of Craig Ervine's drive. Close ...
Mirwais strays onto a leg stump line, and is nudged down to fine leg for a single.
not a great deal of movement, but a nice line, shooting across the left-hander's bows. Ervine leaves.
solid forward defensive. Ervine presses his weight onto his front foot, and plays it right under his eyes.
he's off the mark now, tapping a length delivery just between extra cover and mid off for a single.
Chamu comes back and across to defend back down the track.
neatly whipped off the pads, but straight to Rashid Khan at midwicket.
Ervine is half forward to defend this length delivery on off stump.
beaten on the drive outside off! Ervine flashed at this with uncharacteristic fervour, but it fizzed right past the bat.
and again! There's been some definite help for the seamers first up, and this one leaves the batsman off the track to beat the edge.
Ervine presents the full face of the bat in defence.

got him! After beating the bat twice, Dawlat has found the edge. Ervine wanted to drive again. The ball was up there for the shot, but the seam movement took it further away from him. The ball kissed the edge and nestled snuggly in Shahzad's gloves. Dawlat is embraced by his team mates as he pumps his fists in celebration.
Williams isn't far forward, but his hands come down right over this full ball as he checks a drive to cover.
Mirwais zones in on that line and length outside off, and Chamu can only defend.
hands on heads for the bowler and the slips as this ball flicks off the inside half of the bat and rolls down to fine leg.
definite swing there. The ball leaves Williams through the air and he leaves it alone.
and again, patient stuff.
Mirwais swings it away, Williams leaves it alone.
brave single! Williams tapped the ball just to the left of mid-off and set off. The fielder fumbles, and it's a good run in the end.
full, and just a little wide outside off. Williams comes forward to defend.
Dawlat aims for the yorker, but it slips out as a low full toss. Dug out back down the track, with just enough room for a single.
nurdled into the leg side, just wide of midwicket.
Williams walks into a drive as Dawlat continues to pitch the ball up, but it's toe-ended to mid off.
driven a little more firmly this time, but a diving extra cover sees to it that there's no run.
pushed defensively back to the bowler, and another disciplined over comes to an end.
that's the first real error from Mirwais. Down the leg side, wide.
the bowler readjusts with a good length delivery on off stump, and Chamu defends to cover.
a touch straighter, and Chamu's flick is intercepted by a tumbling midwicket fielder. Afghanistan's fielding has been good this morning.
placed through the covers! Mirwais offered just a little width, and Chamu caressed the ball through the gap at cover. Good timing.
tempting stuff, just outside off. This time Chamu leaves alone.
another cracking drive! The pitch seems like it's beginning to settle now. The batsman has just leaned forward into this, checking his hands and keeping his left elbow high.
and now off the back foot! It's not timed quite as well, but Chamu punches two runs through cover point.
Nabi comes round the wicket, Williams defends.
punched to the bowler's left, he fields in his follow through.
pressed firmly to mid off.
reverse sweep, but he's missed it and there's an appeal for lbw ... Not given! Bit of glove? Outside off? Hard to tell.
defended back to the bowler
this is just a little short, and Williams stays deep in his crease to flick to leg.
watchful defence from the left hander.
full outside off, and he's driven to long off.
the batsman comes well forward to defend to extra cover.
too short from the bowler, and Chamu steps back to force a single to long on.
big hit! Williams bends low and slams this sweep up and over square leg. He's hitting to the short boundary, and he's cleared it with ease.
and now Williams back way away to leg, and thumps a cut to cover ... Straight to the fielder.
turned with the spin to square leg.
a full, wide ball is squeezed through backward point.
Williams gets back and across to work a single behind square, Nabi coming round the wicket.
much too short, outside off, and punished by the batsman. Chamu gets back and thrashes a backfoot shot through cover.
a quicker ball, and it spits just a little outside off. Chamu makes sure to stay on top of it.
flicked back at the bowler, who gets down on one knee to stop it.
chipped to mid off! Williams probably wanted to go straighter than this, but punched too early at the ball to present a simple catch to the mid off fielder.
beaten outside off! Hamza comes round the wicket and spins one away from Chigumbura's outside edge.
driven to extra cover, off the front foot.
tapped to point, off the back foot.
Elton is half forward to defend a quicker one.
this time the batsman lunges well forward to smother the ball into the off side.
a touch of drift, but it's very full and eased down to long off.
looped down on middle and off, the batsman defends.
drift, grip and spin hurries Elton's defence.
beaten outside off! Sharp spin. Shahzad whips the bails off, but his foot is grounded.
this slips out as a full toss, and it's muscled down to long on.

got him! This has been a lovely over from the young leggie. Again he hung this one in the breeze, and it drifted in deceptively. He expected it to pitch and turn, but it rushed straight on, and he'd played outside it. Umpire Nigel Llong upholds the appeal, and Zimbabwe are in serious trouble at 45 for 4.
Elton is well forward to defend.
again he comes forward, pushing to the bowler.
pushed to extra cover off the back foot.
squirts off the outside edge! The ball went straight to ground though, and rolled through gully.
appeal for stumping! Hamza speared a quick one past Raza's outside edge, and Shahzad demolished the stumps. But the batsman's back foot had gone nowhere.
pressed softly back to the bowler.
appeal for lbw! This looked like a googly, but it started straight and was headed down the leg side.
Elton lunges forward to smother the spin.
Now the batsman uses his feet to get to the pitch and drive to extra cover.
a wristy flick sends the ball down to long on.
flapped just wide of extra cover, off the front foot, and he's off the mark.
another wrong 'un, and it pops off the batsman's hip into the leg side.
Raza comes well forward to defend to the short extra.
looped down outside off, solid defence.
rinse, repeat. Hamza targets a full length on off stump, Raza defends.
a touch short outside off, and it's cut to cover.
nicely driven, but straight to short extra.
very full on off stump, and it's dug out to point.
Elton is forward in defence, but the ball spins past his outside edge.
a little straighter, and he's nudged to leg.
width offered outside off, and a controlled square drive goes to backward point.
Elton skips down the track to get right at the ball, but his shot is stopped at mid on.
defended from the crease, into the leg side.
again the batsman uses his feet, and this time he drives down to long off for a single.
arrowed down on a length outside off, Raza defends.
full, pushed back to the bowler.
beaten by bounce outside off! He was trying to ease this down to third man, but couldn't get anything on it.
a touch too full, and the drive sends the ball to long off.
watchfully defended back to the bowler.

is this a dead ball? I definitely saw a signal from the umpire, but Raza just pulled away as it was bowled, and then still played a shot to defend to cover. I'm not sure what the problem was. Raza is gesturing to his ear. Was someone talking to him from behind the stumps? In the end, it's called a live ball and they get on with it.
driven down to long off.
Raza stands at the crease and defends.
floated down full outside off, and Raza cracks a drive to the sweeper.
punched to cover point off the back foot. Elton seems to be using his feet well.
Googly! And it spins sharply. But the batsman has read it, and defends easily.
punched out to cover sweeper.
a little short outside off, and the cut is chopped down to backward point.
fuller this time, and it's driven to extra cover.
quicker one, full outside off, and the batsman defends.
solid defence once more.
Elton comes forward, and this time angles the bat on a checked drive to pick up a single to the sweeper.
Raza drives at extra cover, who is beaten by a difficult bounce in front of him, and they snatch the chance for a single.
Raza comes forward, and then goes back to defend.
a little too short outside off. Raza forces it away off the back foot, and a misfield by Stanikzai at cover allows a single.
eased down to long on.
Raza comes down and thrashes the ball hard down to long on. Some aggression on the stroke.
cut to point, cleanly fielded.
flicked into the leg side, straight to midwicket.
a drive is drilled into the covers, but straight at the fielder. Afghanistan have been on point with their field placement.
Raza is back and across, and gets the bat down on a wrong 'un just in time.
quick running, the ball being tapped just wide of mid on.
crunched away! Rashid floated this one up well outside off, and Elton met it with a flowing drive. Well placed, supremely timed.
pushed through quicker, but still outside off. Left alone.
a fizzing legspinner is defended to extra cover. I really do like the look of Rashid. He's not dissimilar to Pakistan's Yasir Shah in style. Quick arm, lots of energy.
too short, and Raza steps back to create width outside off, crunching the ball powerfully to the deep cover boundary.
tapped just wide of the man inside the circle at cover, the sweeper cleans up as they trot through.
solid forward defence from Zimbabwe's captain.
nudged, with the spin, through the gap at square leg.
Raza is forward to defend this flighted offspinner. Nabi doesn't flight many of them.
a sweep is gloved into the leg side, dribbling about three metres from the batsman.
punched through the covers, out to the sweeper.
squirted, uppishly towards point. But the ball falls safely.
too short, and it's thrashed with a tennis forehand off the back foot, down the ground. Long off comes around to stop the ball.
edged! But just short of a diving Nabi at slip. Raza was on the drive.
too short again from the young leggie, and Raza is back and across in a flash, setting himself to muscle a pull to wide long on.
full, and driven to long off for one.

a needless run out! Raza tapped the ball just wide of mid on, but called immediately for the single. He was running to the danger end, so it was his call. Chigumbura must have heard the call, but he turned around and watched the ball instead of running. By the time he eventually set off, with Raza shouting for the single again, the ball was already being thrown to Shahzad. Ball-watching results in a run out.
looped down on off stump, Tino defends.
Tino shuffles right across to off, and turns the ball defensively to leg,
defended with the spin into the leg side.
Tino stretches his long left leg well down the track as he comes forward to defend.
good use of the feet, Tino coming down and driving confidently to long on.
a wrong 'un spins in, hitting the batsman on the hip.
flicked through the leg side, towards wide long on.
again Tino flicks to leg, though more softly this time.
arrowed down on off stump, Raza's defensive stroke goes between cover and point so there's room for a single.

stumped! Tino came down the track, but the ball was really short and he couldn't get close to the pitch of it. There was sharp spin, away from the bat, and by the time he turned himself around Shahzad had smashed the stumps down. Another one goes, and Zimbabwe sink even further
Jongwe gets deep in the crease and defends.
eased down to long off for one.
full outside off, pressed back to the bowler.
Jongwe, who is in his red cap, comes down the wicket to drive to long on.
Raza takes his bottom hand off the bat and places the ball through cover point for one.
Jongwe comes forward, then quickly shifts back to defend.
and now the batsman is fully forward to defend.
Raza is immediately into a paddle-scoop of a sweep, and the ball bounces safely down to fine leg for a couple.
big spin! Raza came well forward, but the revs on the ball beat him.
driven into the covers, straight to the fielder.
full and straight, flicked off the toes to midwicket.
Raza is slightly off balance as he comes forward, but he lays bat to ball to get the ball to cover.
punched through extra cover, off the back foot and out to the sweeper.
Raza comes forward on the drive, and places the ball wide of a diving cover fielder inside the ring.

n the air, but safe! The ball was quite short, and Jongwe stepped back to set himself for a pull. But instead of spinning away, it rushed straight on to confuse his stroke, and he ended up chipping down the ground. Short of the fielder there!
defended back to the bowler.
turned into the leg side, straight to midwicket.
eased back to the bowler once more.
Raza is on the drive, coming forward, and gets the ball to long off.
the loosener comes down full outside off, and it's left alone.
pitched up even fuller this time, and the batsman's drive bounces out to deep cover. The sweeper has a long sprint around the boundary to get to it, but does so.
a touch short on middle, and Raza pulls to midwicket on the edge of the ring.
chopped down late on it, but straight to the backward point fielder.
again Raza waits in the crease for the guide to third man, but he's aimed it at that deep backward point fielder again.
full outside off, and Raza's drive is intercepted at extra cover.
just a little short, and Jongwe stays on the back foot to get the ball through cover point.
not quite full enough again from the bowler, and Raza cuts into the deep.
nicely full, and the batsman comes forward to drive it back to the bowler.
quicker and flatter through the air, Jongwe defends.
very full outside off, and Jongwe digs out a drive to extra.
variation from the leggie? This one definitely seemed to rush straight on, and it takes the inside half of the bat before rolling to short fine leg.
full outside off, and he's driven to deep cover
Jongwe gets across to off stump to defend to leg
full outside off, and the batsman angles the ball to the short third man/deep backward point fielder.
whipped off the pads for a single.
nicely placed, through cover point off the front foot.
full and straight, a wicket-to-wicket line, and the batsman is forward in defence.
Jongwe comes down the track, but the ball is very full already and he's almost turned it into a yorker. Dug out.
quicker one, and the batsman defends.
Jongwe is forward to drive to long off.
ah, lovely flight from Shenwari. Raza waits on it to defend from the crease. Shenwari seems to have found a good rhythm.
punched to extra cover, off the back foot. Straight to the fielder.
eased down to long off, one more.
driven out to the cover sweeper.
punched back to the bowler, off the back foot.
looped down full, outside off, and it's fetched into the leg side with plenty of bottom hand.
short, and pulled hard at the midwicket fielder, Nabi. The ball bursts out of his hands, and they run an overthrow.
full outside off, and he's driven to deep cover.
turn and bounce outside off! But Raza rides it well to find a single through cover point.

well placed, and well timed! Shenwari offered up a delicious long hop, and Raza hammered it up and over wide long on, the ball bouncing once before the rope. The fielders in the deep are at deep midwicket and long on.
tapped off the back foot, to cover.
again Raza is back to force the ball to cover, this time the ball beats a diving fielder.
a quicker one, but very short. Jongwe, who is a tall man, is right back and pulls it away off his sternum.
chopped down to point.
full outside off, and Raza laces a square drive out to the sweeper.
looped down outside off, Raza is forward in defence.
tapped back to the bowler.
quicker one, outside off, and it's squirted to point.
chopped down to gully, no run.
solid forward defence ends the over.
pushed down the leg side by the bowler, and Jongwe lays bat to ball to get a single through square leg.
Raza shimmies down the crease to get close to the ball, defending it back to the bowler.
up and over long on! With the fielder up, Raza took the chance to smite a flighted ball high over the boundary for six. Really well hit.
and there's his fifty! A vital knock for his team. Again Raza goes aerial, but straight down the ground this time, and it bounces a couple of times before crossing the boundary.
defended down softly into the off side.
full and wide outside off, and Raza flashes a square drive out into the deep.
nothing for the batsman to work with, Hamza spearing the ball in at off stump from around the wicket.
a touch too short, Raza stays back and punches to long on.
Jongwe is half forward to defend to off.
placed in front of point, and there's a sprinted single.
Raza takes one step down the pitch, and defends.
punted down to long off for one.
short, straight, and it's pulled to long on.
tapped wide enough to the bowler's right for a single.
Raza jumps out and aims a one-handed drive to the sweeper.
googly, but it's read off the track and punched easily through the covers, off the back foot.
dug out back to the bowler.
punched to backward point, where the fielders converge to cut it off.
nudged gently back to the bowler.
flicked to Hamza's right. He races across and backhands the ball back to the stumps, but the batsman is safe.
eased down to long on.
short outside off, Jongwe thumps a cut out to the sweeper.
Raza comes well forward to defend.
Raza whips through the line with plenty of bottom hand to collect another single. He doesn't look at all comfortable running.
drifting and dipping down at the batsman's left foot. It's dug out on the leg side and Jongwe calls for the single.
punched through extra cover.
Raza steps back and across to defend.
a low, dipping full toss is clipped to deep midwicket.
Jongwe fakes backing away, then walks across to off and chops a quick ball down to gully.
driven to long on for one.
Jongwe has an almighty swing at this full ball outside off, but swings right past it.
Jongwe backs away to let to drive into the off side, but pings the field.
really well played by young Jongwe. The ball was full and wide outside off, and he lifted the square drive up and over the infield, placing it well enough to beat the sweeper.
Jongwe drives the ball hard back into the pitch, and it bounces up and over Dawlat in his follow through.
short outside off. Raza forces it away off the back foot, and then hobbles through a stiff-legged single.
sore calf or not, Raza is still pushing himself on these single. Jongwe inside edges this one into his pad, and Raza calls for a sharp run. Good call.

slog swept out to deep midwicket! Well, he went for the shot straight away. The connection was alright, but it went too high and not far enough. The fielder settles under the high chance, and holds it cleanly.
off the thigh pad, the ball rolling to leg.
tip and run single, to cover point.
a quicker one, from round the wicket, is aimed at the batsman's pads. Chisoro drives to long on.
well played, but just the single. Raza dabs the late cut to short third man.
speared down very fast, and Chisoro defends back to the bowler.
Raza has a horrid slog across the line at a length delivery, and walks away angrily to square leg, chattering to himself. He'd be better off hitting straight. Play and a miss
that's more like it. The ball is full, and the bat is straight as it's chipped down the ground. They hurry back for two.
punched just wide of extra cover, and they take a sharp single. Raza is in major discomfort with that knee/calf.
Chisoro slaps a full ball into the covers. He wants a single, but is sent back.
heaved across the line, down to long on.
Raza gets across to off, and down on one knee, looking to ramp the ball over the keeper. He doesn't connect, and there's half an appeal for lbw.
Chisoro comes down the track, but that turns the ball into a yorker and he can only dig it out.
driven hard down to long-on.
flicked into the leg side, with the spin. No run.
a checked on drive gets the ball to long-on
Chisoro comes down again, and drives to long off. Absolutely no flight whatsoever from Nabi in this over.
punched down to long-off, just a single.
oh dear, Raza is down and rolling on the ground. He is in major pain. He tried to heave this length delivery into the leg side, but it slammed directly into his groin with a resounding thud.
length delivery, on off, and Raza stands at the crease to flat bat the ball straight back over the bowler's head.
sliced over extra cover this time, the batsman clearing the left leg. Raza somehow hobbles through to runs. He looks like he can barely walk.
flicked into the leg side, the bottom hand coming over. Again he pushes for two. Gritty stuff from Raza.
another flat-batted forehand goes out to long off, falling well short of the fielder.
flicked off the toes, into the leg side. Chisoro keeps strike.

byes, three of them. Chisoro jumped out, head pointed to the sky, and swung wildly. The ball zipped past him, past the keeper, and down towards the boundary. It's cut off, and Raza digs deep to get back for three.
Raza clears his front leg, and hammers the ball out to the cover sweeper. Two more. I don't know where he's finding the strength.
slog swept hard out to deep square. The fielder runs in, and dives, but can only parry the ball forward as it bounces in front of him. Two more, and Raza is down on his haunches, breathing hard.
driven hard to cover, quick single.
thumped to long off, one more.
and Raza keeps the strike with a firm drive down the ground. He hobble/walks to the other end and collapses onto his knees. 12th man runs out with a drink, and he creaks slowly to his feet.
short ball, and the pull is spliced to deep square. There's applause from the crowd as they push yet another two.
a full, reverse swinging yorker is dug out to cover, and they chance a quick single.
Chisoro walks right across, trying to lift the ball over short fine. He doesn't connect.
dug out back down the ground, Dawlat zoning in on the yorker.
hurled down well wide of off, called wide.
sliced up high towards mid off, the fielder runs back, settles underneath it, and holds the catch. A brave knock comes to an end.
yorker, right on off stump, is dug out to gully and they take a single.

inn2.comm: swinging away outside off, and it's left alone.
this one goes the other way, but it starts too straight and goes down the leg side.
Tinashe finds his radar with this delivery, wobbling around on off stump, and it's defended from the crease.
a touch shorter, outside off, and a cut is bottom edged through to the keeper, on the bounce.
another cut from the batsman, but this one goes to point.
wider still, but the flashing shot off the front foot is stopped at cover point.
Panyangara lands this one straight, and on a length, and it's driven to mid on.
rising off a length, outside off, and Shahzad's feet are rooted to the ground as he forces the ball to cover.
another flat-footed shot, and again it bounces into the covers.
wide outside off. Shahzad throws the bat at it, but can't get anything on it. Wide.
short, outside off, and Shahzad smacks it hard in front of square. The ball beats midwicket, mid on and runs away.
the length is better this time, but Shahzad shuffles across and flicks off his pads for a single through square leg. Masakadza sprints across from midwicket to keep them to one.
Noor Ali hops at the crease to ride the bounce on a back of a length delivery, defending it straight down.
forced to cover point, off the back foot, but with no great timing.
Shahzad is starting to get his feet moving now. He walks across and taps a length delivery to cover point.
punched off the back foot, and just wide enough of mid off to allow a quick single.
a whippy punch off the back foot flies to point, where it's cleanly stopped by the fielder.
tapped into the covers, where Chari dives to cut it off. But he can't stop the single.
pushed down the leg side, another extra.
he follows that up with a better delivery, aimed at the top of off. Shahzad stays in the crease and defends.
Shahzad hacks at a short ball outside off, bottom edging the shot down to third man.
appeal straight away! Shahzad swept hard at the ball but missed it completely, and was struck on the pad. The appeal was an insistent one, but Umpire Matibiri is unmoved.
pushed through a little fuller, and Shahzad eases the ball to long on.
Noor Ali comes down the track and swings somewhat wildly into the leg side, the ball going to midwicket along the ground.
driven back down the ground. The bowler gets his right hand to it, but palms the ball away and they take a single.
tapped back to the bowler.
and defensive stroke ends the over
driven, on the up, to Tino at extra cover.
miscued up and over mid off, the fielder backpedals furiously but can't get close to the ball as it lands safely. They rush back for two.
Noor Ali comes half forward to drive again, and Tino stops the shot at extra cover.
nicely bowled, up to the bat but not quite there to drive. The batsman nudges it gently to mid on.
short ball, and it's well directed on a middle stump line. Noor Ali gets across to off stump, and hooks at it, but makes no connection.
a wristy flick sends the ball towards midwicket, where Masakadza dives to stop it.
full and straight, and Shahzad takes the easy option of a single to long on.
a touch short of off stump, and it's cut into the covers.
Williams sprints across from extra cover, putting in a dive to stop the single.
chipped in the air, but dropping well short of the midwicket fielder.
drift in with the arm, and not a great deal of turn. The batsman is cramped for room as he plays it off the back foot.
Shahzad sweeps hard, getting the ball well in front of square, and deep midwicket runs around to keep them to two.
a leg glance is inside edged onto the pad, and the batsmen are alert to the chance for a quick single.
a nice looking drive from the wicketkeeper-batsman. His feet didn't move much, but his hands went right over the ball. Stopped at extra cover.
just a little too short, on a middle stump line, and Shahzad hops to work the ball into space on the leg side.
this nips a little off the seam, and Noor Ali takes the bottom hand off the handle as he fends to leg.
tapped into the covers, and it's Tino again who gets across quickly to stop the single.
well bowled. This would have hit the top of off had Noor Ali not hurried his defence to keep it out.
this wasn't all that short, but Shahzad set himself for the pull. He connects, but it's stopped at midwicket.
pushed firmly to cover.
once again the cover fielder is in action to stop an aggressive drive.
nicely struck! Shahzad got down early and nailed the slog sweep over square leg. One bounce and it's over the rope.
heavy wrist work on a quicker ball gets the ball down to long on.
pushed in slightly ungainly fashion to Williams at extra cover.
punched back past the bowler, the batsman's feet rooted to the spot but the full bat face presented in the stroke. Chisoro fields at mid-on.
defended back to the bowler, Panyangara hitting a length on off stump.
a bottom-handed swipe bounces to Tino at extra cover
the bottom hand takes over again, and Shahzad finds a single just wide of mid on with a helicopter drive.
flicked in rather more classical style, and with greater timing too. Noor Ali lifts his back leg as he clips a full ball right between midwicket and mid on.
Panyangara pulls his length back, and the batsman defends.
Shahzad drives hard, but aims the stroke at cover.
solid forward defensive to a flighted delivery.
an attempted slog sweep, but ball beats bat and hits the pad.
flicked into the leg side, but it's stopped inside the ring.
pushed down the ground. Mid-on dives over it, but long off comes around to stop the boundary.
nudged back to the bowler.
Noor Ali flicks the ball from off stump, out through square leg. There's a man in the deep to stop it.
Panyangara flings down a bouncer, and Shahzad ducks. He also plays an odd little swipe at the ball, but it's an afterthought.
another short ball, on off stump this time. Shahzad tries to ramp it, but ball whizzes past bat.

yet another short ball. This is clearly the plan to Shahzad. He was in no position to play a shot, flailing wildly at the ball, but he manages to connect and send the ball very fine down to fine leg, though it didn't look like he knew where that might go.
Panyangara now aims for the yorker, and Shahzad is fortunate to get a bottom edge on the ball as he swipes across the line. The ball rolls down to fine leg.
a controlled pull from Noor Ali, rolling his wrists over the ball to get it down to fine leg.
punched off the front foot, the ball rolling to cover.
well played again by Noor Ali. He looks in good nick, coming down the track and chipping the ball neatly over mid on.
Williams spears one down much quicker, and it's tapped back to him.
flicked off the pad, and it's stopped by Chisoro at square leg.
placed in front of square on the leg side this time, and they sprint back for two.
turned to Ervine at midwicket, off the back foot.
hacked in the air, up and over cover, out to the sweeper.
Noor Ali waits deep in the crease, allowing the ball to turn, and cuts to point.
nicely bowled, the ball drifting in with plenty of flight. Watchfully defended.
wide outside off this time, and it's toe ended to cover.
plenty of spin for the bowler. This pitched well outside leg, but spins across to off, beating the batsman's swipe to leg and hitting him on the pad.
punched down the ground to long off for one.
looped down on off stump, and it's eased to long off. Williams signals to get his extra cover straighter.
nicely flighted, on middle, and the batsman leans forward to defend.
good shot! Shahzad gets nice and low and nails a sweep along the ground, and behind square to beat Chisoro at square leg.
oh dear, Chamu makes good ground running across from mid on as Shahzad whips to leg, but then dives over the ball. They're back for two.
chopped down behind square, and it's stopped at short third.
solid defence ends the over.
pushed firmly back to the bowler.
flighted full on middle and leg, and he's clipped to deep midwicket.
pushed through quickly outside off, and Shahzad shows temperance to leave it alone.
nicely played, plenty of wrist on the stroke to place the ball into space at midwicket.
play and a miss outside off! He wanted the cut, but it was too full and too close to him.
a sliced cut rolls to backward point.
pushed through on off stump, from around the wicket. A clean, diving stop at point stops runs.
flicked to mid on, off the front foot.
some grip and spin for the bowler, and Shahzad defends it back to him.
punched to mid off, who is very deep. There's time for an easy single, and neither bowler nor keeper are impressed.
driven back to the bowler, who drops low to drop the shot.
eased out to wide long on.
Noor Ali works the ball against the spin to find a single to midwicket.
flighted up nice and high, but Shahzad meets the ball with a controlled sweep and collects a single to long leg
pushed through full, and wide of off. Tapped out to the cover sweeper.
not a lot of control in this stroke, but it's effective enough. Shahzad swings through a one-handed sweep and picks up two to midwicket.
heaved off the back foot, and again midwicket hauls it in.
driven firmly off the front foot, straight to mid off.
Shahzad backs away to leg as Chisoro trundles in, but the bowler follows him and he must defend.
blasted over wide long on! Shahzad heaves mightily to send the ball into the stands, really well struck.
driven to extra cover, off the front foot.
swiped down to long on, just the one.
quicker ball from Chisoro. Noor Ali digs it out, and Chisoro picks it up, threatening to throw down the stumps. Good to see some vim from Zimbabwe, it seemed they'd just about gone to sleep.

gone! Noor Ali responds with an aggressive swipe outside off, but he's cut the ball in the air and straight to Chigumbura in the covers. Chisoro bellows his celebration in the batsman's direction as Noor Ali trudges off. Finally, Zimbabwe break through, though Afghanistan are already in a great position.
flighted very temptingly up outside off. Shahzad throws the bat out at it, but can't connect.
solid defence this time.
out comes the paddle sweep, the ball rolling down to fine leg. 1000 runs for Shahzad in ODIs!
Nabi is off the mark straight away with a drive to long off.
Shahzad leans right across, and then angles his bat across his front pad to collect a single to midwicket.
a slashed drive goes into the covers.
fifty up for the portly right hander, and it's warmly applauded by his team mates from their balcony. His first of the series, and he gets there with a glance off his pads into the leg side.
quicker ball from Chisoro, Nabi punches back to the bowler.
Nabi flicks to square leg. Shahzad wants a single, but there's none to be had.
another nurdle to leg, and Ervine stops it at square leg.

athletic, diving stop by Masakadza at cover point! He's really good in that area. Nabi cut hard, and it looked like four but Masakadza stops it with minimum fuss, diving, stopping and getting it back to the keeper in a flash.
driven softly back to the bowler.
Nudged into the leg side, again it's Masakadza to stop it at midwicket.
cut hard, straight to point.
swiped away! Shahzad gets down on one knee and hammers a powerful sweep to wide long on, along the ground.
almost stumped! Shahzad came down, and was beaten in the flight, but it hit his boot and Mutumbami couldn't get the bails off in time.

in the air, and safe! Now he slog sweeps, and the ball loops up towards deep square. Williams calls for it, running back from square leg, and though he dives he can't reach the ball. It still bounced a metre or so ahead of him.
boom! Nabi rubs it in with a powerful strike straight down the ground.
Afghanistan are on the attack! Shahzad backs away to leg, making room, and lofts the ball powerfully over extra cover.
much quicker through the air, and Shahzad hurries his defence.
flicked into the leg side, Chisoro himself sprints across to stop it.
punched down to long on, an easy single.
placed through square leg, one more.
pulled in the air, out towards long on, but bouncing well short of the fielder.
swept hard, but straight to Mutombodzi at midwicket.
that's landed in the practice nets! Shahzad is having some fun now. This was on a length and straight. He just cleared his left leg and swung cleanly through the line.
and he follows that up with a single down to long on, rotating the strike.
Nabi takes the single on offer to long on.
another stroke down the ground, another single.
one more to the total, Nabi pinging long on again with another drive.
Nabi comes forward to drive out to the cover sweeper
Shahzad puts his weight onto his back foot and hammers a pull out to Raza on the boundary.
quick single, Nabi placing the ball to midwicket.
this has pinged out of the middle! Shahzad got into a good position, down on one knee of on off stump, and swept the ball hard down to fine leg.
full outside off, and it's driven to the fielder at cover point.
into the stands! Shahzad is into the 80s now, and rushing towards a memorable hundred. He comes down the track and smashes the ball over midwicket.
full and straight, he drives to mid on.
another full ball from Jongwe, and it's defended back to the bowler.

there's a collision between the fielders, but Nabi is caught! He wanted to send this over the infield, with both mid on and mid off up, but top edged the stroke. Both Panyangara, at mid on, and Masakadza, at midwicket, wanted it. Masakadza set himself under the ball, and held the catch even as Panyangara bumped into him, knocking him over. But he shows good commitment to hold on, and Zimbabwe break through again. Is it too late?
on a length, on off stump, and it's tapped to point.
outside off, and it's left alone.
probing line from Jongwe, on off stump, and it's defended back to him.
arrowed down from around the wicket, tapped back to the bowler.
another quick delivery, almost medium pace, and it's defended to extra cover.

great catch. The fielder had to run back from midwicket, dive and catch it over his shoulder. Guess who? It's Sikandar Raza, and he shows no tiredness in his legs as he leaps in the air and flings the ball up in celebration. The shot was on for Shahzad, as there was no one on the boundary, but his stroke was top edged.
Is this an opening for Zimbabwe?
beaten outside off! Chisoro held this one back a touch, and it gripped and turned past Stanikzai's defensive poke.
full, just outside off, and it's driven softly to extra cover.
past the edge again! This was a little shorter, and Stanikzai wanted to play it off the back foot. But the ball bounced and turned much more than he expected.
angled in towards off stump, and Nawroz defends to gully.
Nawroz looks utterly solid in defence as he comes forward. Straight bat, right under the eyes.
a touch shorter this time, and it's defended off the back foot.
driven back down the ground, and it hits the non striker, ricocheting to mid on.
well bowled! Nawroz hurries his defence as this length delivery cuts back in.
just outside off, angling in, and it's defended to point.
full and fast outside off, angled to gully.
Stanikzai comes forward to drive to mid off.
punched to extra cover off the back foot.
a touch too straight, and it's flicked to square leg for one.
chopped down very late indeed by the batsman, and it goes past a diving Ervine at slip, down to short third man.
past the edge! The ball seems as though it's starting to grip and spin a little more now. Chisoro hops in excitement, but the batsman hasn't touched it
defended off the back foot, back to the bowler.
flicked out to the fielder at deep square.
chopped down to third man, another single.
effort ball from Jongwe, and he grunts upon release. The batsman presses forward to defend.
full and straight, and it's flicked off the pads for a couple.
short, and it's pulled hard and high in the air, the ball bouncing away to the deep midwicket boundary. If there was a plan, it didn't work.
a touch too short, and it's pulled to midwicket.
Chisoro comes round the wicket, and the batsman defends to cover.
pushed back to the bowler.
the batsman comes well forward to smother the spin in defence.
a drive rolls into the covers, plenty of fielders there to stop it.
pushed through full and wide outside off. Stanikzai won't be tempted, and leaves alone.
Nawroz gets up on his toes to tap the ball to point. He looks for a single, but the fielder is quickly in.
short and rising outside off. Nawroz is up on one leg as he ramps it in the air down to third man.
hurled down the leg side, and he'll have to bowl that one again.
a much better line and length, right at off stump. The batsman defends to point.
Jongwe probes on off stump, but Stanikzai's defence holds firm.
consistent bowling, length on off stump, and the batsman is happy to defend.
just short of a good length, on off stump, and Stanikzai defends off the back foot this time.

great awareness from Ervine! He was at slip, but as Nawroz telegraphed his intentions to paddle-sweep he started to move behind the keeper. The ball popped up off the bat-handle/glove and Ervine found himself in the perfect position to hold an easy catch. Another wicket!
beaten outside off! Wonderfully flighted by Chisoro, drawing the batsman forward and then beating him with grip and spin.
quicker now, and straighter, the batsman nudging to midwicket.
he's off the mark with another flick off the pads, this time the ball goes through square leg.
punched to cover, off the back foot.
driven back to the bowler, who tumbles to his left to stop it.
very full on off stump, almost the yorker, and it's dug out to cover.
very full again, and the ball squirts off the inside edge, rolling through square leg.
hurled down the leg side now, a wide. Try again.
a low, dipping full toss is heaved out to deep midwicket, where there is a man on the boundary.
the ball seems to be tailing in through the air just a bit, and Shenwari flicks this off the hip to midwicket.
Yep, definite inward movement through the air. This comes in quite sharply to sting the batsman's thigh.
an appeal for lbw! Panyangara is reverse swinging it here. This one hoops in, but there's some inside edge on it.
tailing in towards off stump, and Shenwari presents the full face of the bat to defend to cover.
sliced down to short third man, straight to the fielder.
just a little too short from the bowler, and Stanikzai jumps back into position to thump it to the wide long on boundary. That will ease the nerves a bit.
full and flat, on off stump, and Stanikzai defends.
Stanikzai chops down on a cut, and the ball bounces to Chigumbura at point.
solid defence from the batsman.
Stanikzai comes forward to drive, but his shot is aimed straight at Williams at extra cover.
Panyangara aims nice and full with the inswinger, and it's dug out back to him.
again Shenwari digs out the full one, but this time it bounces over the bowler, and past Ervine's outstretched hand, and they sneak a single.
Stanikzai pokes forward in defence, the ball goes to cover.
Panyangara aims for the surprise bouncer, but the batsman is quick enough to get into position and roll his hands over the ball to collect four to fine leg.
much fuller this time, and it's nudged to square leg.
full and straight, defended back to the bowler.
slightly awkward defence, but kept out.
pushed back to the bowler.
watchful defence, the batsman well forward.
again he's forward, pushing it to the bowler.
nudged to extra cover, off the back foot.
a touch short outside off, and Stanikzai over-hits it, hacking the ball to cover on the bounce without much timing. Had he got it through, it was four.
speared in at the pads, and it's flicked to short fine leg.
Stanikzai drives, and Masakadza dives at extra cover to stop it.
good energy from Wellington, he puts in another dive to stop the single
defended softly to cover. Fielders converge from all directions.
Stanikzai wanted to sweep, but the ball ragged off the turf to beat his shot.
heaved up and over mid on. He's not got all of it, so Jongwe is able to race back from mid on and stop it before the boundary.
glanced through the vacant square leg, an easy single.
squeezed out to point.
chopped down through gully.
pushed back to the bowler.
very full, and dug out to mid off.
darted in on leg stump, and it's flicked to long leg.
a better line, and Shenwari defends.
looped down full and straight, tucked to midwicket.
past the edge! Great line outside off. But the batsman didn't touch it.
punched back to the bowler. There's a bit of an exchange between the batsman and the bowler.
Shenwari is forward to drive, the ball rolling to cover.
mid on is up, so Stanikzai is confident coming down the track to hit Masakadza over his head. In fact, he hits it so well that he picks up six. Afghanistan nudge closer to the win.
driven to cover, Williams fields
cut to cover point, again he hits the field.
punched to extra off other back foot.
angled down to backward point.
another boundary! Afghanistan are closing in. Again Stanikzai came down the track, this time hitting the ball slightly wider to wide long on.
looped down on middle and off, defended.
quicker one, flicked off the pads to midwicket.
Shenwari hurries to get his bat down on a Williams dart.
flicked off the toes to midwicket.
flighted this time, and Shenwari places it just wide of midwicket.
another quick little dart, and it hits the batsman on the foot.
defended back down the track.
nice placement on the late cut, he gets it fine of Panyangara to pick up a couple.

off the splice, and it lobs easily to Ervine at slip! Shenwari was well forward, and the ball bounced more than he expected. Simple catch for the slip fielder, and Afghanistan lose another, on the brink of victory.
ice cool! Shafiqullah steps down and crashes his first ball cleanly over mid on for four.
quicker ball, tapped back to the bowler.
this one is held back a touch, dipping on the batsman, who comes forward to defend.
Williams attacks off stump, from around the wicket, and Stanikzai defends.
sharp run! He tapped the ball just to Ervine's right at midwicket, but Shafiqullah wanted the single. A direct hit would have had him ...
gentle forward defence, back to the bowler.
nudged to mid on.
smart catch! Shafiqullah flicks, but in the air, and Ervine dives forward to hold it inches above the turf. He also did well to hold on as both elbows hit the ground.
swept hard, but straight to the fielder at long leg, just the single.
expressive drive, but the timing isn't there and it bounces to cover.
flicked to leg, quick single.
tapped down to cover point, they think about the single but decide against it.
past the edge! Hands on the head from the bowler.
Stanikzai is forward to drive to extra cover.
flicked just behind square on the leg side, Stanikzai keeps strike.
bowled him! Afghanistan are stumbling on the brink. Stanikzai played inside the line to one delivered from round the wicket, and it spun across him to hit the off stump.
but not straight away. He's back and across to defend to midwicket.
full outside off, and he drives to mid off.
stretching defence from the batsman.
excitement in the field as he's hit on the pad, but it was headed down leg.
pushed back to the bowler.
squeezed out to point, off the front foot.
off the pad, straight to square leg.
extended appeal for lbw! Wellington was convinced! But Umpire Matibiri turns him down.
tapped to mid off, who is very deep, so they rush through for one.
tapped back just past the bowler, but mid on is quickly in.
solid forward defence, and Masakadza fields off his own bowling.
speared down on leg stump, turned to square leg.
crouching defence from the batsman.
how has this not bowled him? The ball pitched outside leg, spun back to beat the sweep, but somehow missed the stumps as well.
here's the game! Rashid draws Afghanistan level with a swipe over long off, the ball clearing the boundary by several metres.
